definitions.definition: To exchange two things, with both parties giving one thing and taking another thing.
To give something else in response (where the "thing" may also be abstract, a feeling or action ) To make a reciprocal gift.
examples: I gave them apples from my tree; they reciprocated with a pie and some apple jelly.

definitions.definition: To move backwards and forwards , like a piston .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To exchange two things, with both parties giving one thing and taking another thing.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To give something else in response (where the "thing" may also be abstract, a feeling or action ) To make a reciprocal gift.
( intransitive ) To move backwards and forwards , like a piston .
( intransitive ) To counter , retort or retaliate .
